question: 塁打
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>baseball base</kanji> <kanji>hit</kanji> is a <vocabulary>base hit</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>single</vocabulary> in baseball terms. A <ja>二塁打</ja> is a double, a <ja>三塁打</ja> is a triple, and a homerun is something you'll learn here on WaniKani at some point if you haven't already.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You've learned the readings for both of these kanji, so you should be able to read this word already!
